# Acutrack Design System 
# v1.0.92

A comprehensive, accessible React design system built with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS. Provides consistent, professional UI components for building modern web applications with **100% reliable iconography** and **complete offline support**.

## üöÄ Latest Updates (v1.0.92)

### ‚ú® Improvements

**Table ‚Äì horizontal scroll by default, full width in cards:**
- **allowHorizontalScroll**: New prop on `Table.Root` (default `true`). Tables now fill the full width of their container (e.g. card) and show a horizontal scrollbar when content is wider than the container instead of smushing cells. Set `allowHorizontalScroll={false}` for fixed layout (columns fit to container).
- **Scroll container**: When horizontal scroll is enabled, the table uses `min-w-0` on the scroll container so it stays bounded by its parent in flex/grid/cards ‚Äî the scrollbar appears correctly (aligned with VirtualizedTable behavior).
- **Table width**: With horizontal scroll, the table uses `w-full min-w-max`: full width when content fits, overflow with scroll when content is wider.

**Form/input components ‚Äì default tertiary border, focus brand/validation:**
- **Default (unfocused) border**: All form and input-like components use a **tertiary** border in both light and dark mode (`border-border-color` / `dark:border-dark-border-color`) when unfocused. This gives a consistent, neutral look across Input, PasswordInput, Textarea, NumberInput, Slider, SearchBar, Select, and MultiSelect.
- **Focus (or open)**: On focus, the border and focus ring switch to the **brand** or **validation** color from the `color` prop (design tokens: primary ‚Üí brand-orange, success ‚Üí system-success, warning ‚Üí system-warning, danger ‚Üí system-error, info ‚Üí system-info). Theme token changes apply everywhere; standard, dev- and backend-friendly approach.
- **Components updated**: Input, PasswordInput, Textarea, NumberInput, Slider, SearchBar, Select, MultiSelect.

**Docs:** TABLE_DOCUMENTATION (allowHorizontalScroll, horizontal scrolling section, usage examples), Table test page (Horizontal scroll demo, Playground toggle), CHANGELOG, VERSION_HISTORY, ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE, INPUT_COMPONENTS_USAGE_GUIDE, and README updated for v1.0.92.

---

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.91)

### ‚ú® Improvements

**Dark mode ‚Äì color alignment and scrollbars:**
- **Scrollbar colors**: Dark mode scrollbars now use the current dark theme (`dark-bg-primary` #13161d, `dark-bg-tertiary` #1d2227) for `.custom-scrollbar` and `.ds-scrollbar-global`.
- **Button grey-primary**: In dark mode, base uses light background and dark text; hover and disabled states use `!important` so they apply correctly. Disabled opacity in dark mode set to 60% for better visibility.

**Table ‚Äì scrollable body scrollbar and custom header height:**
- **Table.Body**: When `isScrollable={true}`, the body now uses `custom-scrollbar` so vertical scroll has themed scrollbars (light/dark). Horizontal scroll on the table wrapper already used `custom-scrollbar`.
- **Table.Header**: New optional prop `headerHeight` (number for px or string e.g. `'48px'`) to set a custom header row height.

**Docs:** CHANGELOG, VERSION_HISTORY, TABLE_DOCUMENTATION, ACUTRACK_DS_USAGE_GUIDE, and README updated for v1.0.91.

---

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.90)

### ‚ú® Improvements

**Stepper ‚Äì Connector lines, alignment, and behavior:**
- **No-gap connectors**: Horizontal connector lines meet step circles with no gap; vertical layout fixed so text sits correctly beside the circle.
- **Content alignment**: In horizontal orientation, title and description are left-aligned under the circle.
- **completedIcon**: New `Stepper.Step` prop to override the completed-state icon (default `"check"`), e.g. `completedIcon="check_circle"`.
- **Connector color**: The line after a step is colored only when that step is **completed**, not when it is the current (active) step.
- **Future steps**: Incomplete steps use 60% opacity; smooth transition when status changes.
- **Docs**: PROGRESS_INDICATORS_GUIDE updated with Color/Variant, completedIcon, Behavior (v1.0.90), and full Props tables.

**SearchBar ‚Äì showSuggestionsList only:**
- **showSuggestionsList**: Single prop to control when the suggestions dropdown is shown. When `false`, the dropdown is never shown. Use e.g. `showSuggestionsList={value.trim().length >= 2}` for address-style.
- **Removed minCharsToShowSuggestions**: Replaced by passing a boolean to `showSuggestionsList` (e.g. from input length or API state).
- **Docs**: SEARCHBAR_README updated with examples and API table; address-style pattern documented.

**Accordion ‚Äì Variants, primary border, and content spacing:**
- **Primary variant**: When `color === 'primary'`, the default variant has no border for a cleaner look; other colors get a subtle border when `isBordered` is true.
- **Variants**: Clear options ‚Äî `default`, `minimal`, `bordered`, `outlined`, `elevated`, `filled` ‚Äî each with distinct container and header styles.
- **Content spacing**: Content block below the divider uses `pt-4` for consistent spacing between header and body.

---

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.89)

### ‚ú® Improvements

**Input ‚Äì Color prop and error state in dark mode:**
- **Color prop**: Border and focus ring now display correctly in both light and dark mode for all colors (primary, success, warning, danger, info). Each color includes proper `border` width and dark mode variants.
- **Error / success / warning**: Full dark mode styling; state styling takes precedence over the `color` prop.
- **Docs**: "Color and theme behavior" and "Avoiding the browser 'Please fill out this field' popup" (use `noValidate` on the form for custom-only validation).

**PasswordInput ‚Äì onBlur prop:**
- **onBlur**: New optional `onBlur?: (e: React.FocusEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => void` for blur validation and real-time validation flows.

---

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.88)

### ‚ú® Improvements

**Sidebar ‚Äì Hide on Mobile by Default:**
- `hideOnMobile` now defaults to `true` (sidebar hidden on mobile by default)
- Provides cleaner mobile experience with sidebar off-screen until opened via hamburger
- **Breaking Change**: To show sidebar on mobile (old behavior), explicitly set `hideOnMobile={false}`
- Mobile breakpoint adjusted from 768px to 767px (tablets like iPad Mini now show sidebar)

**useMediaQuery ‚Äì Enhanced DevTools Emulator Support:**
- Added Visual Viewport API listeners for better viewport change detection
- Added `orientationchange` event listener
- Development-only polling (800ms) to catch emulator dropdown changes
- Layout now adapts immediately when selecting devices in Chrome DevTools emulator

**Input & Form Components ‚Äì Disabled State, Floating Label, Ghost, Primary/Secondary:**
- **Disabled state**: Input (and similar) use a distinct disabled look: gray background, muted border, dimmed text/placeholder/label/helper/icons; dark mode uses darker background and container opacity. Cursor `not-allowed` on the whole control.
- **labelMode**: Input, Textarea, PasswordInput, Select, NumberInput, MultiSelect support `labelMode?: 'top' | 'floating'` (default `'top'`). Use `'floating'` for a label inside the field that floats up on focus or when the field has a value.
- **Ghost variant**: Transparent border by default; border appears on hover/focus so ghost is distinct from primary.
- **Primary/secondary**: Primary = white background; secondary = light blue/tertiary. Applied across form components (Input, Select, Textarea, etc.).
- **Number input**: CSS ensures `input[type="number"]` has a visible solid border so it matches text inputs.

---

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.87)

### ‚ú® Improvements

**Table & VirtualizedTable ‚Äì Striped Rows (2nd, 4th, 6th...):**
- Stripes now apply to the 2nd, 4th, 6th... data rows; the first data row uses the base background.
- **Table:** `even:bg-bg-tertiary/50` ¬∑ **VirtualizedTable:** `(startIndex + index) % 2 === 1`.

**Drawer ‚Äì Comprehensive Refactor with Industry-Standard Libraries:**
- Refactored with `framer-motion`, `focus-trap-react`, and `react-remove-scroll` for better accessibility and UX
- Eliminated layout shifts during scroll locking
- Fixed focus management with reliable focus trapping
- Simplified animation logic with declarative `AnimatePresence`
- Preserved scroll position without `body.style` manipulation
- Fully backward compatible ‚Äì all props and API unchanged

### üêõ Bug Fixes

**DashboardTestPage ‚Äì `t()` Return Type (TypeScript):** `t()` now always returns `string` via `getTranslation(...) ?? fallback`, fixing `string | null` errors for Header.Search, UserMenu, VirtualizedTable, and labelMap.

**FileUploaderTestPage ‚Äì Validation Errors Display (TypeScript):** Fixed TypeScript errors by using correct `FileValidationError` properties (`error.file.name`, `error.errors.join(', ')`) and moving JSX to `children` prop.

**Drawer ‚Äì Panel No Longer Overrides Custom Position/Size** (by William Stovall, 98576bc):  
The panel‚Äôs base classes no longer include hardcoded position or size. `position`, `size`, `className`, and `style` work as documented.

**Sidebar ‚Äì Safelist for Mobile Overlay:** `translate-x-0` and `-translate-x-full` were added to the Tailwind safelist so the Sidebar mobile overlay slide-in/out is not purged when `hideOnMobile` is used.

---

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.86)

### ‚ú® New Features - Language Selector Enhancements

**Gender & Plural Translation Support** (by William Stovall):
- `getTranslation()` now accepts `count` and `gender` parameters
- Supports `"singular" | "plural"` and `"masculine" | "feminine"`
- Perfect for Spanish, French, German and other gendered languages

```typescript
// Simple singular/plural
getTranslation("item", "en", [sources], false, undefined, "plural"); // "items"

// Gendered plural example (Spanish)
getTranslation("employee", "es", [sources], false, undefined, "plural", "feminine"); 
// Returns: "empleadas"
```

**New LanguageSelector Variants**:
- Added `text` and `none` variants for greater styling flexibility
- Dark mode text color fix (`dark:text-white`)

```tsx
<LanguageSelector language="en" variant="text" onLanguageChange={setLang} />
<LanguageSelector language="en" variant="none" onLanguageChange={setLang} />
```

### üêõ Bug Fix - Language Helper Fallback Error

Fixed a critical issue in `getTranslation()` where null/undefined keys could cause errors (by William Stovall).

```typescript
// Before: Could throw error
getTranslation(undefined, "en", [source]); // Error!

// After: Safely returns null or fallback
getTranslation(undefined, "en", [source]); // Returns null
getTranslation(undefined, "en", [source], true, "Default"); // Returns "Default"
```

---

## üêõ Previous Updates (v1.0.85)

### Bug Fixes

**Min/Max Date Validation**: `minDate`/`maxDate` now properly disable dates outside the range (previously only controlled navigation).

**Initial Display Month**: Calendar now starts at the correct month when constraints are set (e.g., birth date picker starts at maxDate month).

**Year Picker Display**: Year range now shows in correct order (smaller to larger).

### New Features

**Flexible Date Input**: `minDate`/`maxDate` now accept strings in various formats:

```tsx
// All of these now work:
<DatePicker minDate="2024-01-15" />           // ISO format
<DatePicker minDate="01/15/2024" />           // US format (MM/DD/YYYY)
<DatePicker minDate="15 Jan 2024" />          // UK format
<DatePicker minDate="January 15, 2024" />     // Natural format
<DatePicker minDate={new Date(2024, 0, 15)} /> // Date object (still works!)
```

**Popover Position Support**:

```tsx
<DatePicker position="top-start" />    // Opens above input
<DatePicker position="bottom-end" />   // Opens below, aligned right
```

**New Exports**:
```tsx
import { parseDateInput, DateInput } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.82)

### üìÖ Complete Calendar System Overhaul

**Major refactor of the Calendar component with comprehensive design system architecture:**

**Design System Features:**
- **5 Visual Variants**: `solid`, `soft`, `outline`, `minimal`, `glass`
- **7 Semantic Colors**: `primary`, `secondary`, `success`, `warning`, `danger`, `info`, `neutral`
- **5 Size Options**: `xs`, `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`
- **4 Density Options**: `compact`, `comfortable`, `spacious`, `relaxed`
- **4 Navigation Styles**: `modern`, `dropdown`, `buttons`, `default`

**Multi-Mode Selection (Industry Standard):**
```tsx
// Single date selection
<Calendar mode="single" value={date} onDateSelect={setDate} />

// Range selection with adjustable/draggable ends
<Calendar 
  mode="range" 
  rangeValue={range} 
  onRangeSelect={setRange}
  adjustable={true}
  draggable={true}
/>

// Multiple date selection
<Calendar mode="multiple" multiValue={dates} onMultiSelect={setDates} />
```

**Dual Calendar Mode:**
```tsx
<Calendar
  mode="range"
  numberOfMonths={2}
  independentNavigation={true}
  rangeValue={selectedRange}
  onRangeSelect={setSelectedRange}
/>
```

**Advanced Range Selection:**
- Industry-standard 3-state interaction (Clean Slate ‚Üí Start Selected ‚Üí Complete)
- Hover preview while selecting end date
- Drag start/end handles to adjust range
- Cross-calendar selection support
- Variant-specific range styling

**Custom Date Formatting:**
```tsx
// Presets: short, medium (default), long, full, iso, us, eu, uk
<DatePicker dateFormat="long" />              // January 6, 2026
<DatePicker dateFormat="iso" />               // 2026-01-06

// Custom date-fns format strings
<DatePicker dateFormat="dd/MM/yyyy" />        // 06/01/2026

// Custom format functions
<DatePicker dateFormat={(date) => `Week ${getWeek(date)}`} />
```

**New Dependencies:**
- `react-day-picker` v9.13.0
- `date-fns` v4.1.0

## üöÄ Previous Updates (v1.0.74)

### üîç Select Component Search Functionality
- **Dual Search Modes**: 
  - `isSearchable={true}` - Traditional dropdown with search input inside (click to open, then search)
  - `allowTyping={true}` - Type directly in the select field itself (no separate search input, filters as you type)
- **Enhanced Filtering**: Search works on both option labels and descriptions for comprehensive filtering
- **Search Input Features**: Search icon, clear button, sticky positioning, custom placeholder support
- **Keyboard Navigation**: Escape clears search, Enter selects first filtered option, typing doesn't close dropdown
- **UX Improvements**: Search term auto-clears on selection, loading state support, custom "No options found" message
- **Use Cases**: Perfect for product selection, user assignment, location selection, and any long list scenario

### üé® Select Component Focus Border Removal
- **No Focus Border on Trigger**: Select trigger (button/input) no longer shows focus border for cleaner appearance
- **Optional Search Focus Border**: New `showSearchFocusBorder` prop to control focus border on search input (default: false)
- **Consistent with Input Component**: Matches Input component behavior - no focus borders by default

### üîß ToggleSwitch Disabled State Fix
- **Label Visibility**: Disabled state now only applies to the toggle component, not the label
- **Better UX**: Labels remain fully visible when toggle is disabled, only the toggle switch appears disabled
- **Proper Cursor**: Label cursor changes to `cursor-not-allowed` for proper UX feedback

### üîß Card Component CSS Build Fix
- **Fixed CSS Template Literal Issue**: Resolved CSS minification warnings caused by template literal syntax in custom gradients
- **Hybrid Approach**: Standard gradients use Tailwind classes, custom gradients use inline styles
- **Clean Build Output**: No template literal artifacts in final CSS
- **Backward Compatible**: All existing gradient functionality works the same

### üìú Auto-Applied Scrollbar Styles
- **Dropdown Components**: Automatically apply `custom-scrollbar` class when `maxHeight` is set or when scrollable
- **Better Developer Experience**: No need to manually add scrollbar classes to dropdowns
- **Global Utility**: New `.ds-scrollbar-global` class for auto-applying scrollbars to all scrollable elements
- **Consistent Appearance**: All scrollable dropdowns now have styled scrollbars automatically

### üéØ Sidebar Component Enhancements
- **CollapsibleSection Fix**: Users can now manually collapse/expand sections even when they have active children
- **Visual Styling**: Removed unnecessary icon wrapper divs, improved spacing consistency
- **Better State Management**: Sections only auto-expand when sidebar transitions from collapsed to expanded

### üîß Autocomplete Improvements
- **State Management**: Improved state handling with key-based reset for edit form scenarios
- **Value Preservation**: Existing values are preserved when switching between disabled/enabled states
- **Edit Form Support**: Enhanced support for edit forms with proper value management

### üêõ Bug Fixes
- **MultiSelect Dropdown**: Fixed dropdown visibility issues with proper z-index and overflow handling
- **MultiSelect Chips**: Resolved alignment issues and implemented auto-adjusting height for better UX
- **MultiSelect Colors**: Fixed chip colors to properly reflect success, warning, danger, and info states
- **Autocomplete State**: Resolved state corruption issues when switching between disabled/enabled states
- **Card Overflow**: Fixed card overflow issues affecting dropdown visibility

## ‚ú® Features

- **60+ Components** - From basic inputs to complex data tables
- **üé® Comprehensive Icon System** - 2,000+ Material Symbols with automatic fallbacks
- **üì¶ Complete Offline Support** - Bundled fonts, no external dependencies
- **TypeScript First** - Full type safety and excellent developer experience
- **Accessibility Focused** - WCAG AA compliant with proper ARIA support
- **Theme Support** - Light and dark mode with customizable color schemes
- **Responsive Design** - Mobile-first approach with breakpoint system
- **Performance Optimized** - Virtualized tables and efficient rendering
- **Developer Friendly** - Consistent APIs, comprehensive documentation, live examples
- **ü§ñ AI Assistant Ready** - Built-in prompts for consistent usage

## üöÄ Quick Start

### Installation

```bash
npm install @acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds
```

### Basic Usage

```tsx
import { Button, Input, Card, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
import '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/dist/style.css'; // Includes bundled fonts

function App() {
  return (
    <div>
      <Button variant="primary" leftIcon={<Icon>home</Icon>}>
        Hello World
      </Button>
      <Input label="Name" id="name" placeholder="Enter your name" />
      <Card>
        <Card.Body>Welcome to Acutrack Design System!</Card.Body>
      </Card>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## üé® Icon System

### **Revolutionary Icon Experience**

Our icon system provides **100% reliability** with automatic fallbacks and complete offline support:

```tsx
import { Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// ‚úÖ Any valid Material Symbol works automatically
<Icon>home</Icon>                    // Common icon
<Icon>location_on</Icon>             // Previously "invalid" 
<Icon>unfold_more</Icon>             // Previously "invalid"
<Icon>brand_new_google_icon</Icon>   // Future Google icons work instantly!

// ‚úÖ With size and styling
<Icon size="lg" color="primary">settings</Icon>
<Icon size="2xl" filled>favorite</Icon>
<Icon hasHoverEffect clickable>touch_app</Icon>
```

### **Key Icon Features**

- **üöÄ Automatic Icon Support** - Any valid Google Material Symbol works instantly
- **üîÑ Smart Fallbacks** - Emoji/Unicode alternatives when fonts don't load
- **üì¶ Complete Offline** - No external CDN dependencies
- **üéØ Future-Proof** - New Google icons work immediately without package updates
- **üé® Color Variants** - Primary, secondary, success, warning, error, info, brand colors
- **‚ö° Interactive States** - Hover effects, clickable states, accessibility support

### **Fallback System**

Icons automatically fallback when:
- Material Symbols font is not loaded
- Invalid icon name is provided  
- Network issues prevent font loading
- Browser doesn't support Material Symbols

**Examples:**
- `home` ‚Üí üè† (Material Symbol or emoji fallback)
- `settings` ‚Üí ‚öôÔ∏è (Material Symbol or emoji fallback)
- `invalid_name` ‚Üí ‚ùì (Help icon fallback)

## üé® Customization

### **Flexible Styling with CSS Custom Properties**

Our components are designed to be flexible and customizable:

```tsx
// Component-level customization
<Input label="Email" id="email" align="center" />
<Input label="Name" id="name" align="right" />

// CSS Custom Properties
:root {
  --acutrack-input-label-align: center;
  --acutrack-input-text-align: center;
  --acutrack-input-padding: 1rem;
  --acutrack-input-border-radius: 0.5rem;
}

// Utility Classes
<Input 
  label="Custom Input" 
  id="custom" 
  className="acutrack-text-center acutrack-mb-4" 
/>
```

### **Available Customization Options**

- **Text Alignment**: `left`, `center`, `right`
- **Spacing**: Margin and padding utilities
- **Border Radius**: Customizable corner rounding
- **Font Weight**: Typography control
- **Display**: Flex, block, inline utilities

- Dropdown, MegaMenu, Stepper
- Calendar, Slider, ToggleSwitch

## üîß API Consistency

Our design system follows strict API consistency principles:

- **Standardized onChange handlers** across all input components
- **Consistent prop naming** (e.g., `onChange` instead of `onValueChange`)
- **Semantic prop structure** (e.g., `description` prop for Alert components)
- **Proper contrast ratios** for all button variants in both light and dark modes
- **WCAG AA accessibility compliance** for all components

### **üé® Animation System Overhaul**
- **Clean Interactions** - Removed all scaling and transform animations for cleaner UX
- **Preserved Hover Effects** - Maintained color and background changes on hover
- **Consistent Behavior** - All dropdown and interactive components follow same patterns
- **Performance Optimized** - Reduced CSS complexity and improved rendering speed

- **Label and Input Alignment** - Both labels and input fields respect alignment settings
- **Design System Integration** - Uses custom CSS classes for consistent styling

### **üé® Universal Border Radius Support**
- **Flexible Radius Options** - All form components support 6 radius options: none, sm, md, lg, xl, full
- **4px Default** - Medium radius (4px) as the new default for modern, clean appearance
- **Consistent API** - `radius` prop across all form components for unified control

## üõ†Ô∏è Setup Requirements

### **Minimal Setup (Recommended)**

```tsx
// 1. Install the package
npm install @acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds

// 2. Import CSS (includes all fonts)
import '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/dist/style.css';

// 3. Use components
import { Icon, Button, Card } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

### **Tailwind CSS Configuration**

```js
// tailwind.config.js
module.exports = {
  content: [
    "./src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}",
    "./node_modules/@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}"
  ],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        // Your custom colors
      }
    }
  },
  plugins: []
}
```

## üöÄ Usage Examples

### **Universal Position Support**
```tsx
// Select Component
<Select
  label="Choose an option"
  options={options}
  value={value}
  onChange={setValue}
  position="top" // 12 position options available
/>

// MultiSelect Component
<MultiSelect
  label="Select Categories"
  options={options}
  selectedValues={values}
  onSelectedValuesChange={setValues}
  position="bottom-end"
/>

// Autocomplete Component
<Autocomplete
  label="Search"
  options={options}
  value={value}
  onChange={setValue}
  position="left-start"
/>

// DatePicker Component
<DatePicker
  label="Select Date"
  value={date}
  onChange={setDate}
  position="top-start"
/>

// EnhancedDatePicker Component
<EnhancedDatePicker
  variant="range"
  value={dateRange}
  onChange={setDateRange}
  position="right"
/>

// SplitButton Component
<SplitButton
  primaryActionLabel="Save"
  onPrimaryClick={handleSave}
  dropdownPosition="bottom-end"
>
  <Dropdown.Item>Save As...</Dropdown.Item>
</SplitButton>

// All 12 position options available:
// 'bottom', 'bottom-start', 'bottom-end'
// 'top', 'top-start', 'top-end'
// 'left', 'left-start', 'left-end'
// 'right', 'right-start', 'right-end'
```

### **Border Radius Support**
```tsx
// Button Component
<Button
  variant="primary"
  radius="md" // 'none' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl' | 'full'
>
  Click Me
</Button>

// Input Component
<Input
  label="Email"
  id="email"
  value={email}
  onChange={setEmail}
  radius="lg" // 8px border radius
/>

// Select Component
<Select
  label="Country"
  options={countries}
  value={country}
  onChange={setCountry}
  radius="full" // Fully rounded (50%)
/>

// All form components support radius:
// Input, Textarea, PasswordInput, Select, Autocomplete, 
// MultiSelect, DatePicker, EnhancedDatePicker, Checkbox, Radio
```

### **Text Alignment Support**
```tsx
// Input Component
<Input
  label="Name"
  id="name"
  value={name}
  onChange={setName}
  align="center" // 'left' | 'center' | 'right'
/>

// Select Component
<Select
  label="Choose Option"
  options={options}
  value={value}
  onChange={setValue}
  align="right"
/>

// Textarea Component
<Textarea
  label="Description"
  id="description"
  value={description}
  onChange={setDescription}
  align="center"
/>

// Checkbox Component
<Checkbox
  label="I agree to terms"
  id="terms"
  checked={agreed}
  onChange={setAgreed}
  align="right"
/>

// Radio Component
<Radio
  label="Option 1"
  id="option1"
  name="options"
  value="1"
  checked={selected === "1"}
  onChange={handleChange}
  align="center"
/>
```

### **Clean Animation-Free Interactions**
```tsx
// All components now have clean hover effects without scaling
<Button variant="primary">Hover me</Button>        // Color changes only
<Select options={options} />                       // Smooth dropdown
<Dropdown.Item>Click me</Dropdown.Item>            // Background changes only
<DatePicker value={date} onChange={setDate} />     // No scaling animations
```

### **Icon Usage**
```tsx
// Basic usage
<Icon>home</Icon>

// With props
<Icon size="lg" color="primary" filled>favorite</Icon>

// Interactive
<Icon hasHoverEffect clickable aria-label="Settings">settings</Icon>

// In components
<Button leftIcon={<Icon>add</Icon>}>Add Item</Button>
<Badge icon={<Icon>check_circle</Icon>}>Success</Badge>
```

### **Component Integration**
```tsx
// Form with icons
<Input 
  label="Search" 
  leftIcon={<Icon>search</Icon>}
  rightIcon={<Icon>filter_list</Icon>}
/>

// Navigation with icons
const navItems = [
  { label: 'Dashboard', icon: <Icon>dashboard</Icon>, href: '/dashboard' },
  { label: 'Settings', icon: <Icon>settings</Icon>, href: '/settings' }
];
```

## üìã Changelog - v1.0.57

### **üé® Animation System Overhaul**
- **Removed scaling animations** from all interactive components
- **Eliminated transition effects** (duration, transform, scale)
- **Preserved hover effects** (color changes, background changes)
- **Improved accessibility** for motion-sensitive users
- **Enhanced performance** with reduced CSS complexity

### **üìç Universal Position Support**
- **Added position prop** to 7 components with 12 positioning options each

### **üìù Universal Text Alignment Support**
- **Added alignment prop** to all form components with 'left', 'center', 'right' options
- **Consistent API** across Input, Select, Textarea, MultiSelect, DatePicker, EnhancedDatePicker, Autocomplete, Checkbox, Radio, PasswordInput
- **Label and Input Alignment** - Both labels and input fields respect alignment settings
- **Custom CSS Classes** - Uses acutrack-text-left, acutrack-text-center, acutrack-text-right utilities

### **üé® Universal Border Radius Support**
- **Added radius prop** to all form components with 6 options: 'none', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl', 'full'
- **4px Default** - Changed default radius from 6px to 4px for modern appearance
- **Consistent API** across Button, Input, Textarea, PasswordInput, Select, Autocomplete, MultiSelect, DatePicker, EnhancedDatePicker, Checkbox, Radio
- **Developer Friendly** - Easy customization for different design needs

### **üîß Components Updated**
- **Toast** - Fixed auto-close and close button functionality, added smooth exit animations, removed unnecessary hover effects
- **NumberInput** - New component with stepper controls, icon support, and comprehensive validation
- **Button** - Added radius support, changed default to 4px, added info & success variants, grey theme system
- **Input** - Added alignment support, radius support (already had position support)
- **Textarea** - Added alignment support, radius support
- **Select** - Added position support, alignment support, radius support, removed animations
- **Autocomplete** - Added position support, alignment support, radius support, hover effects, removed transitions
- **MultiSelect** - Added position support, alignment support, radius support, inherited fixes from Dropdown
- **DatePicker** - Added position support, alignment support, radius support, removed scaling, preserved hover effects
- **EnhancedDatePicker** - Added position support, alignment support, radius support, removed scaling, preserved hover effects
- **Checkbox** - Added alignment support, radius support
- **Radio** - Added alignment support, radius support
- **PasswordInput** - Added alignment support, radius support
- **SplitButton** - Added position support, inherited fixes from Dropdown
- **Popover** - Added position support, removed scaling, preserved hover effects
- **Dropdown** - Removed scaling, preserved hover effects (used by Select, MultiSelect, SplitButton)
- **Header** - Inherited fixes from Dropdown
- **VirtualizedTable** - Inherited fixes from Dropdown
- **Calendar** - Removed scaling, preserved hover effects
- **ToggleSwitch** - Fixed TypeScript errors

### **üêõ Bug Fixes**
- **Toast Component** - Fixed auto-close and close button functionality with smooth exit animations
- **Toast UX** - Removed unnecessary hover and active animations for cleaner notification experience
- **Fixed ToggleSwitch TypeScript errors** (unused variables, undefined references)
- **Resolved build warnings** and compilation issues
- **Improved component consistency** across all interactive elements

### **‚ö° Performance Improvements**
- **Reduced CSS bundle size** by removing unused animation classes
- **Faster rendering** with simplified CSS selectors
- **Better browser compatibility** with reduced transform usage
- **Improved accessibility** with motion-reduced interactions
